intro: Argostemma attenuatum, commonly known as the slender argostemma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Vietnam, and Malaysia. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have four petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds.
